title: Chains of circumstance
brief_description: Three case histories of poverty show the work of the Freemasons’ Benevolent Institution in New South Wales. The Institution was founded in 1880 as a means of helping the aged, invalid and distressed. From a system of voluntary subscriptions, annuities are granted to those who need help.
